meanings.def: a long, solid structure that rises straight up from the ground, made of stone, brick or concrete, that surrounds, divides or protects an area of land
examples: to build a wall
a brick/concrete wall
The fields were divided by stone walls.
He sat on the wall and watched the others playing.
The enemy set up camp just outside the city walls.
a private garden hidden behind high walls
They quickly climbed over the wall and ran off.
The Trojans brought the Wooden Horse within the walls.
His plan was to fortify the defensive walls around the city.
Nobody can see behind the wall.
The burglars must have scaled the side wall.
There was a wall separating the two garages.
They built a retaining wall around the pond.
high walls around the prison
the wall along the seafront

meanings.def: any of the sides of a building or room
examples: She leaned against the wall.
on the wall Colourful abstract paintings hung on the walls.
He drilled a hole in the wall.
Books lined the walls.
I'm going to paint the walls white and the ceiling pink.
the row of tables along the back wall
Pictures covered the walls.
wall between A and B the wall between the living room and the dining room
Photos were pinned to the wall behind her desk.
A glass wall separates the foyer from the gallery.
He heard voices through the wall.
Ivy grew along the outer walls of the building.
Hang the picture on the wall opposite the window.
If a load-bearing wall is weakened, the building could fall down.
She covered her walls with pictures of film stars.
She hung the photos on the wall.
She just sat there, staring at the wall.
She turned and faced the wall.
the wall facing the door
to stare at a blank wall

meanings.def: something that forms a barrier or stops you from making progress
examples: The boat struck a solid wall of water.
The investigators were confronted by a wall of silence.
a solid wall of fog

meanings.def: the outer layer of something hollow such as an organ of the body or a cell of an animal or a plant
examples: the abdominal wall
the wall of an artery
Heating food breaks down plant cell walls so they can release more of their nutrients.

meanings.def: a space on a social media website where you can share messages, photos, etc. with other users
examples: She posted a pink baby romper on her Facebook wall, announcing they were expecting a girl.

meanings.def: to keep trying to do something that will never be successful
examples: Trying to reason with them was like banging my head against a brick wall.

meanings.def: to be so full of energy or so excited that you cannot keep still
examples: The kids have been bouncing off the walls all day.

meanings.def: to be unable to make any progress because there is a difficulty that stops you
a person who watches others without being noticed
examples: I'd love to be a fly on the wall when he tells her the news.
fly-on-the-wall documentaries (= in which people are filmed going about their normal lives as if the camera were not there)

meanings.def: to fail because of lack of money
examples: Many firms have gone to the wall in this recession.

meanings.def: used when you are describing a situation in which there are signs that something is going to have problems or that it is going to be a failure
examples: It is amazing that not one of them saw the handwriting on the wall.

meanings.def: to be in a difficult situation in which you are forced to do something but are unable to make the choices that you would like
examples: We had our backs to the wall with no choice but to sell.

meanings.def: to reach a point when you cannot continue or make any more progress
examples: We hit a wall and we weren't scoring.
I’ve hit a wall with my marathon training.
What do you do when you hit the wall at work?
Some of his ideas are really off the wall.
off-the-wall ideas

meanings.def: used when you are talking about keeping something secret
examples: Don't let this go further than these four walls (= Don't tell anyone else who is not in the room now).
That noise is driving me up the wall.
I mustn't be late or Dad will go up the wall.

meanings.def: used to warn people to be careful what they say because other people may be listening
used when you are describing a situation in which there are signs that something is going to have problems or that it is going to be a failure
examples: It is amazing that not one of them saw the writing on the wall.
